Title: The Design and Evolution of OCB - Journal of Cryptology
Description: We describe OCB3, the final version of OCB, a blockcipher mode for authenticated encryption (AE). We prove the construction secure, up to the birthday bound, assuming its underlying blockcipher is secure as a strong-PRP. We study the schemeâ€™s software performance, comparing its speed, on multiple platforms, to a variety of other AE schemes. We reflect on the history and development of the mode.

Title: Welcome to Peter's DevLog - Optional value handling in Nim
Description: I recently had a look at a functional language named ToccataÂ which amongst other things does away with booleans. While this migth seem utterly insane it's not an entirely new concept andÂ proponents of such ideas will warn you of the perils ofÂ boolean blindness. ThisÂ refers to the fact that booleans themselves carry no information apart from their value.Â But as others have pointed out this is true of all values andÂ the linked articleÂ instead refers to the problem asÂ part-blindnessÂ and recommends the user to use a good type system. In this article I'll discuss the ideas behind boolean and part blindnessÂ and muse on the concept of computing and error checking with options.
